abstract: Creates a query for samples that match any of the descriptors you provided.

declaration.code: init(queryDescriptors: [HKQueryDescriptor], limit: Int, resultsHandler: @escaping (HKSampleQuery, [HKSample]?, (any Error)?) -> Void)

overview:
## Discussion

Use this initializer to create a sample query for data that matches any of the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQueryDescriptor] objects. Each descriptor can specify a different data type.

After instantiating the query, call the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKHealthStore] class’s [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKHealthStore/execute(_:)] method to run this query. Queries run on an anonymous background queue. As soon as the query is complete, the system executes the results handler on the background queue, returning samples that match any of the descriptors. You typically dispatch these results to the main queue to update the user interface.

For example, the following code returns all the step count and push count samples:

items.description: Create, run, and sort sample queries.
items.name: Executing Sample Queries

items.description: Instantiates and returns a sample query.
items.name: init(sampleType:predicate:limit:sortDescriptors:resultsHandler:)

items.description: Creates a query for samples that match any of the query descriptors you provided, sorted by the sort descriptors you provided.
items.name: init(queryDescriptors:limit:sortDescriptors:resultsHandler:)

items.description: A value indicating that the query returns all the matching samples in the HealthKit store.
items.name: HKObjectQueryNoLimit

title: init(queryDescriptors:limit:resultsHandler:)
